meanings.definition: To cover or smear with a paste or adhesive substance.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys impasting the paper with glue for her art project.
meanings.sent2: The chef was impasting the dough with butter to make it flaky.
meanings.sent3: The kids were impasting glitter on their handmade cards, creating a sparkly mess.
meanings.sent4: The gardener was impasting the soil with fertilizer, nurturing the plants.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter was impasting the wood pieces together to build a sturdy table.

meanings.definition: The act of applying a thick layer of paint onto a canvas.
meanings.sent1: The artist's impasting of colors on the canvas created a textured masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: Impasting is an important technique in creating depth and richness in paintings.
meanings.sent3: The impasting of paint on the canvas made it look like a deliciously frosted cake.
meanings.sent4: Her impasting of vibrant hues on the canvas brought the artwork to life.
meanings.sent5: The impasting of different shades on the canvas added dimension to the painting.
